CAPTION FIG1.png: 'Figure 1: \\(\\Lambda\\) schematic diagram illustrating how local shape is defined. T represents the average of tangential angles near the point of cell contact. \\(\\Omega\\) is the angle between \\(\\overline{\\rm T}\\) and the membrane normal at the site of attachment, \\(\\overline{\\rm N}\\) . \\(\\blacktriangle\\)\\(\\Omega\\)=2.5\\({}^{\\circ}\\) for cell attachment at end of worm. \\(\\blacktriangle\\)\\(\\Omega\\)=87.5\\({}^{\\circ}\\) for cell attachment on side of worm.\n\n'
CAPTION FIG2.png:
'

**Fig. 2** Scanning electron micrographs of polystyrene **A** worms stretched from 3 \(\mu\)m spheres and **B** worms stretched from 1 \(\mu\)m spheres. Scale bars = 10 \(\mu\)m (**A**) and 2 \(\mu\)m (**B**).

'
CAPTION FIG3.png: 'Figure 3: Time-lapse video microscopy clips at 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 and 32 min after attachment of IgG-adsorbed PS particles to alveolar macrophages. **A**: Macrophage internalizes 3 μm sphere quickly following attachment. **B** Macrophage attaches to side of worm, but does not internalize it. Images have been cropped and magnified identically to show cell/particle detail. Scale bars = 5 μm.\n\n'
CAPTION FIG4.png: 'Figure 4: Average number of spherical and warm-like IgG-adsorbed particles internalized in 22 h as determined by fluorescence microscopy. _Patterned bars_ indicate particle volumes equivalent to 3 \\(\\mu\\)m spheres (\\(p\\)\\(\\sim\\)0.000031) and _solid bars_ indicate particle volumes equivalent to 1 \\(\\mu\\)m spheres (\\(p\\)\\(\\sim\\)0.000024). At least 50 cells were counted for each sample.\n\n'
CAPTION FIG5.png: 'Figure 5: Colored scanning electron micrographs demonstrate the flexibility of IgG-adsorbed (**A**–**C**\\(1\\,\\mu\\)m volume; **D**\\(3\\,\\mu\\)m volume); norm-like particles and ability of macrophages to bend worms by attachment at different points. Scale bars = 2 \\(\\mu\\)m.\n\n'
CAPTION FIG6.png: 'Figure 6: Colored scanning electron micrograph shows macrophage-internalizing an IgG-adsorbed warm (3 \\(\\mu\\)m volume) and the effect of internalization on cell shape. Scale bar = 5 \\(\\mu\\)m.\n\n'
